p:
In the case of GCH1, although a number of genetic studies have suggested that common variants in GCH1 are linked to Parkinson’s disease
9, 17 , other studies have not found an association
53– 55 . Our functional data provide complementary evidence for a role of GCH1 in Parkinson’s disease and other disorders characterized by abnormal aggregation and deposition of α-synuclein.
